note.p: Death: His house, 10 Southwell Gardens, South Kensington (21 October 1889)
Education: Oscott College; Christ's College, Cambridge. MA

Career: Travelled in Europe; studied the Alps; called to the Irish Bar (1845); Assistant Poor Law Commissioner (1846-1847 and 1849-1851); MP for Carlow (1852); Under Secretary of State for the Colonies (1855-1857);
Memberships: FLS; MRIA; Alpine Club (first President 1857)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1889-1890 vol 47 pp v-ix signed by J D H
